results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 10: Episodes 19-20
results.brief_description: The fast-changing ‘20s go galloping on, and the economy worsens as society trips carelessly through its soirees and fashions. A scandal at the insurance company causes Soames to resign from the board in a flurry of anger, and although a birth brings celebration and reconciliation to the family, scandal of another kind is brewing for them. While, in America, romance stirs again for Jon, and there is the hint that not all the wounds of past love have been healed by time.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 09: Episodes 17-18
results.brief_description: The Great War has left Europe tottering on an economic precipice, and Soames, now on the board of a large insurance company, is nervous about its foreign investments. Fleur’s flirtation with the despairing Wilfred Desert ends and she finds herself expecting Michael’s child, much to her father’s satisfaction. Michael, meanwhile, pricked by his burgeoning social conscience, attempts to help a struggling former employee. But this plan backfires and the result brings only anger and shame to the man he seeks to benefit.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 08: Episodes 24-26
results.brief_description: The final chapter in John Galswothy’s epic saga… while Michael busies himself with promoting a slum-clearance scheme, Fleur’s restlessness is further stirred by repeated meetings with Jon - not all of them by chance. Even Soames is persuaded to join Michael’s scheme, and Fleur seeks to quell her growing discontent by opening a rest home for factory girls. But, like Fleur, the past will not rest. The ‘formidable unit’ of the Forsytes is wracked once again by internal feuding, passion and jealousy; and the family’s characteristic doggedness and possessiveness carry us relentlessly towards the series’ moving and unforgettable climax.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 08: Episodes 15-16
results.brief_description: Although the 1920s herald a new age in politics and culture, for the Forsytes, as Soames tells Fleur, “the present is rooted in the past, the future in both”. Fleur and Jon’s relationship is destroyed by the bitter family feud that still lingers on, driving Fleur to a marriage with the socially conscious Michael Mont, and Jon to America after his father’s death. But the emergence of Mont’s best friend, Wilfred Desert, as a threat to their happiness brings the echo of past passions to the story once more.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 07: Episodes 21-23
results.brief_description: John Galsworthy’s epic saga continues… Britain’s first labour government falls and Michael Mont is returned to parliament as a Conservative MP devoted to a radical new school of political thought. The libel suit against Fleur culminates in a dramatic courtroom climax, the result of which sends Fleur and Soames on a trip round the world. When they return, the General Strike is about to erupt. The country is thrown into chaos, and the Forsytes are confronted with painful reminders of earlier emotions as Fleur and Jon meet for the first time in over six years.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 07: Episodes 13-14
results.brief_description: It is now 1918, and the Great war has shaken out the last vestiges of Victorian England. In the Forsyte family, nearly all the older generation are dead, and among the younger members a new love burns, rekindling bitter old feuds. Oblivious to the enduring resentment harboured by their parents, Jon and Fleur meet by chance and fall in love. But the reluctance of Jo, Irene and Soames to reveal the truth of the past to their children makes them all the more determined to discover it.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 06: Episodes 18-20
results.brief_description: John Galsworthy’s saga sees the fast-changing twenties gallop on, and the economy worsens as society trips carelessly through its soirees and fashions. Fleur’s flirtation with the despairing Wilfred ends and she finds herself expecting Michael’s child, much to the satisfaction of her father. Michael, meanwhile, pricked by his burgeoning social conscience, attempts to help a struggling ex-employee. But his plan backfires, resulting in anger and shame for the man he tries to benefit. A scandal at the insurance company causes Soames to resign indignantly from the board, and although the birth of Kit brings celebration and reconciliation to the family, scandal of another kind is brewing. In America, romance stirs again for John, and it would seem the wounds of past love are still open.

Michael, meanwhile, pricked by his burgeoning social conscience, attempts to help a struggling ex-employee. But his plan backfires, resulting in anger and shame for the man he tries to benefit. A scandal at the insurance company causes Soames to resign indignantly from the board, and although the birth of Kit brings celebration and reconciliation to the family, scandal of another kind is brewing. In America, romance stirs again for John, and it would seem the wounds of past love are still open.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 06: Episodes 11-12
results.brief_description: So the feud goes on into the third generation, says Jo, as one century makes way for another. The Boer War draws the younger Forsytes into its web - Jo’s son Jolly and Val Dartie enlist for the army, their dislike for each other growing in intensity; while June and Holly also volunteer as nurses, though each for different reasons. Jo’s blossoming liaison with Irene gives Soames the evidence for a divorce, and as the old queen ends her days, marriages, births and deaths continue to shape the destiny of the Forsyte family.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 05: Episodes 15-17
results.brief_description: John Galsworthy’s remarkable story continues… the 1920’s heralds a new age in politics and culture, but the Forsytes are haunted by familiar tensions. Fleur and Jon’s relationship is destroyed by the bitter family feud that still lingers on, driving Fleur into marriage with the socially conscious Michael Mont, and Jon to America after his father’s death. The emergence of Mont’s best friend, Wilfred Desert, as a threat to their happiness bring the echo of past passions to the story once more; whilst Soames, ever anxious for a grandchild and male heir, has his troubles compounded by the teetering foreign investments of the insurance company on whose board he sits.

results.title: The Forsyte saga. - Vol. 05: Episodes 09-10
results.brief_description: As the century approaches its end, so do the lives of the more senior Forsytes. Jo’s wife, Helene, dies from a fall, before madness destroys her mind, and Jo himself begins to see more of Irene. Soames, meanwhile, desperate for an heir, wants a divorce from Irene and his sister, Winifred, seeks the same from her husband, after he elopes with a Spanish dancer. The lives of a new generation of Forsytes start to take shape, but the recurring conflicts of love and personal animosity carry their bittersweet legacies uncompromisingly towards the twentieth century.
